title: Post-winter storm Red Line delays, reduced service disappoint commuters
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Transportation As of Wednesday evening, Red Line services were running as low as an estimated 17.
5 percent of scheduled trains.
Following the weekend's winter storm, the Red Line has faced a slew of delays and reduced services.

title: Jayson Tatum acknowledges challenges of returning this season for Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics "It is a thought: Do I come back?
Should I wait?
It’s something that I honestly, recently, in the last two weeks or so just kind of contemplate every single day.

title: Cam Newton continues to discredit Drake Maye’s role in Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots They’re not here because of Drake Maye,” Newton said.
“That’s just facts.
Cam Newton believes Drake Maye has been more of a passenger during the Patriots' run to Super Bowl LX.

title: ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest planned for Boston this weekend after Minneapolis killings
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The weekend rally in Boston Common follows a nationwide boycott planned to draw the attention of federal officials.
Mass 50501 has organized a protest Saturday in Boston Common against recent ICE action in Minneapolis.
Darin Zullo/Boston.

title: Fundraisers started for families of Carver birthday party shooting victims as suspect faces judge
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News Jaylen Pina, 20, and Benjiman Cowart, 27, died in a shooting at a child's birthday party in Carver.
Fundraisers have been launched for the two people killed at a child’s birthday party in Carver.
The 2 victims, Jalen Pina, 20, and Benjamin Cowart, 27, were killed at a child’s birthday party at the Saint John Baptist Club on Jan.

title: Pro Football Hall of Fame releases statement amid Bill Belichick snub
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “The selection of a new class is the most important duty the Hall of Fame oversees each year, and the integrity of that process cannot be in question.
” Bill Belichick didn't earn a spot in Canton in 2026.
Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe The Pro Football Hall of Fame released a statement one day after news first broke that Bill Belichick was not going to be a first-ballot entrant.

title: Patriots list Drake Maye as ‘limited’ with shoulder injury in new report
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Beyond Maye's shoulder, Patriots linebacker Robert Spillane is also dealing with an ankle injury.
Drake Maye is dealing with a shoulder injury ahead of Super Bowl LX.

title: Read Robert Kraft’s statement on reported Bill Belichick Hall of Fame omission
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "He is the greatest coach of all time and he unequivocally deserves to be a unanimous first-ballot Pro Football Hall of Famer.

” Robert Kraft and Bill Belichick John Tlumacki/Globe Staff Patriots owner Robert Kraft issued a statement Wednesday regarding the reported omission of Bill Belichick from this year’s Pro Football Hall of Fame class.

title: Patriots to hold Super Bowl send-off rally at Gillette Stadium
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots' send-off rally will feature a musical performance by the Dropkick Murphys, along with speeches from team captains.
Mike Vrabel and the Patriots will head to California on Sunday.

(AP Photo/John Locher) By Conor Ryan January 28, 2026 | 5:41 PM 1 minute to read Before the Patriots make the trek to the West Coast for Super Bowl LX, the AFC championships will celebrate with their fans in Foxborough.
